question: Consider the subsets  $\displaystyle A=\{(1, 1, 1), (0, 1, 1), (1, 2, 3)\}$ and $\displaystyle B=\left\{(1, 1, 1), \left(-\frac{2}{3}, \frac{1}{3}, \frac{1}{3}\right), \left(0, -\frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{2}\right)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $B$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $A$ isn't an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer2: $A$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $B$ isn't an orhtogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer3: $A$ and $B$ are both orthogonal basis of of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer4: $A$ and $B$ are both non-orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$

question:
Let the linear application $F: \mathbb{R}^3\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ be defined by $F(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, 2x+3y+z)$. 
The kernel, $ker(F)$, and the space image of $F$, $range(F)$, are respectively:

A lake has 780 frogs. In the absence of predators, the frog population grows by 15% each month. However, if there are predators, 90 frogs are lost each month.

Give a recurrence relation for the population of frogs after n months, admitting the existence of  predators.
(consider ??, the floor function).
Find relative extrema of the function $f:{\mathbb R}^3\rightarrow {\mathbb R}$ given by $f(x,y,z)=x^2+y^2+z^2-xy+x-2z.$
answer3: $M(-\frac{2}{3},-\frac{1}{3},1)$ is the minimizer and $N(\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{3},1)$ is the maximizer.
answer4: $M(-2,-3,1)$ is the minimizer and $N(2,3,1)$ is the maximizer.

question: In how many different ways can you arrange $8$ guests around a circular table?

Consider the following problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+4x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 25 \text{ (resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 20 \text{ (resource 2)}\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]

Suppose that the only change in the original problem is that new  restriction has been introduced in the model as follows:

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+4x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3} \leq 25 \text{ (resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3} \leq 20 \text{ (resource 2)}\\
& 2x_{1}+3x_{2}+4x_{3} \leq 8 \text{ (resource 3)}\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3} \geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]

Use the Solver Add-in in Excel to solve the new problem. Choose the right answer:
Consider in the three-dimensional cartesian system the plane of equation $\pi: 2x-3y+z-1=0$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(-1, -1, 0)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(-4, 6, -2)$.
answer2: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, 3, 1)$.
answer3: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 1)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.
answer4: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, -1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.

question:

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
 & & y & + & 3z & = & 2 \\
x &  &  & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,\frac{y}{2}\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,-2,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.

For every $m\in\mathbb{R}$, consider the line $r$ of equation $x+my=-3$ and the line $s$ of equation $mx+4y=6$.
Describe the mutual position of $r$ and $s$ with respect to the value of $m$.
answer1: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=-2$, parallel if $m=2$, and secant otherwise.
answer2: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=2$, parallel if $m=-2$, and secant otherwise.
answer3: The lines $r$ and $s$ are secant for every $m$.
answer4: The lines $r$ and $s$ are parallel for every $m$.

2x & + & 3y & - & z & = & 1 \\
x & - & y & + & 4z & = & -2 \\
x & - & 6y & + & 13z & = & -7
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has a unique solution.

Medical researchers analyze how different dosages of a drug affect the duration of relief from allergic symptoms. They want to develop a statistical model to predict the time of relief (in days) based on the dosage of a new drug. Identify the predictor variable and the response variable.
answer1: The predictor variable is a dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the time of relief.
answer2: The predictor variable is the time of relief; the response variable is the dosage of the new drug.
answer3: The predictor variable is the mean of time of relief; the response variable is the mean of dosage of the new drug.
answer4: The predictor variable is the mean of dosage of a new drug; the response variable is the mean of time of relief.

question: In a rectangle:
answer1: There are two lines of symmetry and their diagonals are congruent and intersecting the median point which is a symmetry centre.
answer2: There is just one line of symmetry and its diagonals are congruent and intersect in the median point which is a symmetry centre.
answer3: There are two lines of symmetry and their diagonals are congruent and intersect in the median point.
answer4: There are four lines of symmetry and their diagonals are congruent and intersect in the median point which is a symmetry centre.

question:

$\sqrt{ \dfrac{x}{2}}+3=5$

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the values of the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
 &  & ay & + & az & = & ab \\ 
 &  &  &  & bz & = & a \\ 
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
If $a=b=0$, the system has $\left(x,\,y,\,1-x-y\right)$ as solution for every $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.
If $a=0$ and $b\neq 0$, the system has $\left(x,\,1-x,\,0\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
If $a\neq 0$ and $b=0$, the system has no solutions. 
If $a,b\neq 0$, the system has $\left(1-b,\,\frac{b^{2}-a}{b},\,\frac{a}{b}\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer2:
The system has no solutions for $a\neq b$. 
If $a=b=0$, the system has $\left(x,\,y,\,1-x-y\right)$ as its solution for every $x,y\in\mathbb{R})$. 
If $a=b\neq 0$, the system has $\left(x,\,1-x,\,0\right)$ as its solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(b-a,\,b^{2}-a,\,\frac{b^{2}-a}{2a^{2}+1}\right)$ as its unique solution for every $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
If $a=b=0$, the system has $\left(x,\,y,\,1-x-y\right)$ as its solution for every $x,y\in\mathbb{R}^{2}$. 
If $a=0$ and $b\neq 0$, the system has no solutions.
If $a\neq 0$ and $b=0$, the system has $\left(x,\,0,\,x\right)$ as its solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
If $a,b\neq 0$, the system has $\left(x+a,\,y-\frac{b}{a},\,1-ax-by\right)$ as its solution for every $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 3y & - & z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 3z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{22w+7}{15},\,\frac{-7w-7}{10},\,\frac{11w+11}{30}\bigg)$ for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,6,\,-2\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(3w,\,w-1,\,2w,\,w\right)$ as solution for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.

Consider the matrix 
$$A_k=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}

\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?
answer1: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, 1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$
answer3: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer4: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, -1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$

Find the solution of the following system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &-1 \\ 
&x &+ &y &- &5z &= &2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$\left( -y+\dfrac{1}{3},y, -\frac{1}{3}\right),\, \forall y\in\mathbb{R}$$.
answer2:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$\left( -y+\dfrac{1}{3}z,y, z\right),\, \forall y,z\in\mathbb{R}$$.

answer1: The sample range is at least $30 001$ but at most $90 000$.
answer3: The sample range is at least $30 000$ but  at most $90 000$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 2 \\ 
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\ 
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(\frac{1}{3}+\frac{5}{3}z,\,\frac{4}{3}+\frac{2}{3}z,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has two solutions: $\left(1,\,0,\,-1\right)$ and $\left(0,\,2,\,-1\right)$.

question:
At the HealthPlus hospital, the nursing staff works in $6$ different shifts. Each shift has a duration of $8$ hours, with its start interval of $4$ hours (the first shift starts at $8:00$ AM, the second at $12:00$ AM, the third at $4:00$ p.m., and so on). The number of nurses required during the day is as follows:

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|}
\hline
\text{Day period} & \text{Required number of nurses} \\
\hline
\text{8:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m.} & 140 \\
\text{12:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.} & 120 \\
\text{4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.} & 160 \\
\text{8:00 p.m. to 12:00 p.m.} & 90 \\
\text{12:00 p.m. to 4:00 a.m.} & 30 \\
\text{4:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m.} & 60 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]

In this situation, what are the decision variables to formalize the Linear Programming (LP) model to allow planning the nursing staff.
answer1: None of the options given are correct
answer2: $x$ is the number of nurses working in each shift
answer3: $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ is the number of nurses working in shift $1,~2$ and $3$, respectively
answer4: $x_4$, $x_5$, $x_6$ is the number of nurses working in shift $4,~5$ and $6$, respectively

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & = & 2 \\
3x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & - & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has two solutions, $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ and $\left(2,\,1,\,0\right)$.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(-4+z,\,z,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Find the relative extrema of the function $f:{\mathbb R}^2\rightarrow {\mathbb R}$ given by $f(x,y)=3xy^2-x^3-15x-36y+9$.
answer1: The function $f$ has no extrema points.
answer3: M$(2,3)$ is a minimizer and N$(-2,-3)$ is a maximizer for function $f$.
answer4: M$(2,3)$ is a maximizer and N$(-2,-3)$ is a minimizer for function $f$.

answer3: $M(-\frac{2}{3},-\frac{1}{3},1)$ is the minimizer and $N(\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{3},1)$ is the maximizer.
answer4: $M(-2,-3,1)$ is the minimizer and $N(2,3,1)$ is the maximizer.

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 3y & - & z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 3z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{22w+7}{15},\,\frac{-7w-7}{10},\,\frac{11w+11}{30}\bigg)$ for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,6,\,-2\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(3w,\,w-1,\,2w,\,w\right)$ as solution for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.
